instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an A1708 820-00840-A, that has no boot.
It powers on, the backlight turns on, but it has no chime nither Apple logo. The display stays fully black.

Already tried with a known good display, and with just the board on the bench (external display), but with the same result.

Can you help?

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,

I can't find a ME BIOS. Do you have any link to it?

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no boot
threads.message:
With the new BIOS, the result is the same. BL OK, but with black  screen only.
Even on the external display, the screen turns on but stays black

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no boot
threads.message:
What is CPU core voltage, after 10s?
Check for USB activity.
Also test starting in safe mode.

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no boot
threads.message:
PPVCCCPU_S0G starts at 0.947V and then stays at  0.645V.

I don't have USB activity

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no boot
threads.message:
Looks like board really boots.
It gets stuck for some reason.
Did you test the board in safe mode?

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
Yes, I've tested it in safe mode, and even without disk (to see if the folder icon was showed on display), but nothing happends. Just a black screen, with backlight activated.

threads.title: A1708 820-00840-A no boot
threads.message: Then must be CPU internal problem...
